title: The Glass-Lung Sickness
description: Refugees working the 'Silica-Vents' are breathing in microscopic glass shards. Something is turning the sand into razors.

turns.narrative: The Silica-Vents are beautiful and deadly, filled with a fine, silver dust that hangs in the air like frozen fog. The workers cough into blood-stained rags, their lungs wheezing like old organs.
turns.consequence_a: Success: You find the filters have been precisely slit by a laser-like cut. (+1 Intel)
turns.consequence_b: Success: You extract a perfect, jagged cube of glass from their throat. (+1 Lore)
turns.convergence: A rhythmic 'clinking' sound comes from the main ventilation shaft, like glass chimes in a storm.

turns.narrative: The clinking is coming from a 'Sand-Sifter'—a small, crab-like construct made of fused obsidian. It's actively grinding rocks into the lethal dust.
turns.consequence_a: Success: You snap its grinding-pincers. (+1 Progress)
turns.consequence_b: Success: It's being powered by an illegal 'Warp-Battery'. (+1 Secret)
turns.convergence: The Sifter explodes into a cloud of glass-shrapnel that threatens to shred your cloak.

turns.narrative: The shrapnel is everywhere. You see the dust beginning to swirl and coalesce into a 'Dust-Demon'—a vortex of grinding silica.
turns.consequence_a: Success: The dust becomes heavy and falls to the floor. (+1 Progress)
turns.choice_b: Shield the workers with your body (Con DC 14)
turns.consequence_b: Success: You take the hits, protecting the innocent. (+100 XP)
turns.convergence: The Dust-Demon dissipates, but the air remains thick with the smell of scorched minerals.

turns.narrative: You reach the 'Vent-Control' room. The screens are flickering with images of the 'Glass-Widow'—a mythical figure from the Low-Wastes.
turns.consequence_a: Success: You learn the sabotage was ordered by a rogue faction. (+1 Lore)
turns.consequence_b: Success: You stop the spread of the dust. (+1 Progress)
turns.convergence: A hidden door opens, revealing a chamber filled with 'Lungs of Glass'—preserved human organs transformed into crystal.

turns.narrative: The crystal lungs are pulsing with a rhythmic light. They're being used as 'Bios-Processors' for an unknown calculation.
turns.consequence_a: Success: You end the horrific experiment. (+1 Progress)
turns.consequence_b: Success: You gain a 'Glass-Memory Crystal'. (+1 Loot)
turns.convergence: The facility begins to self-destruct, the glass walls cracking and howling.

turns.narrative: A 'Glass-Sentinel'—a humanoid made of mirrors—steps out from the reflections. It mimics your every move exactly.
turns.choice_a: Close your eyes and fight by sound (Perc DC 15)
turns.consequence_a: Success: You shatter the illusion. (+1 Progress)
turns.consequence_b: Success: The Sentinel cracks in sympathy with your blow. (+1 Progress)
turns.convergence: The Sentinel shatters into a million pieces, revealing a path to the surface.

turns.narrative: The exit is blocked by a wall of solidified silica. It's too thick to break with standard tools.
turns.consequence_a: Success: You melt a hole through the wall. (+1 Progress)
turns.choice_b: Find a bypass through the vents (Dex DC 13)
turns.consequence_b: Success: You crawl through the narrow, glass-lined ducts. (+100 XP)
turns.convergence: You emerge into the cool night air, but your skin is glowing with a faint, silver sheen.

turns.narrative: A medical team meets you. They're terrified of the 'Glass-Sheen'—it's the first stage of the transformation.
turns.consequence_a: Success: You burn the silica from your pores. (+100 XP)
turns.convergence: The vents are quiet. The silica dust has settled.

turns.narrative: The worker you saved offers you a 'Shard-Knife'. He says it's a family heirloom, used to cut through the hardest truths.
turns.consequence_a: Success: You gain a weapon that ignores armor. (+1 Gear)
turns.choice_b: Decline and buy him medical supplies
turns.consequence_b: Success: Your reputation for kindness grows. (+5 Rep)
turns.convergence: The Council declares the Silica-Vents a 'Restricted Zone'.

turns.narrative: You look at the vents from the safety of the Ridge. They look like a field of diamonds in the moonlight—a beautiful, silent graveyard.
turns.choice_a: Write a warning for the miners
turns.consequence_a: Success: You save future lives. (+10 Morale)
turns.choice_b: Keep a vial of the dust (Secret DC 14)
turns.consequence_b: Success: You have a lethal, invisible weapon. (+1 Secret)

conclusion: The Glass-Lung Sickness was a test of biological processing. You stopped the experiment, but the 'Glass-Widow' knows your face.

risk_matrix.penalty: Outbreak spreads. -5 Health for all workers and increased cost of medical supplies.
risk_matrix.critical_failure: The attempt failed quietly. The situation remains unresolved.

unlock_conditions.trigger: Workers report respiratory illness at Silica-Vents
